headline: Trump spokesperson: Babies would have formula if 'our rightful president' was in the White House
author: David Edwards
sentences: Former President Donald Trump's spokesperson falsely suggested on Thursday that the United States has a baby formula shortage because the 2020 presidential election was stolen.
"We would have stocked shelves very full, including with baby formula if Donald J. Trump, our rightful president, was in the White House right now."
During an appearance on Real America's Voice, Trump spokesperson Liz Harrington blasted Republicans who are attending a rally for Georgia Gov.
"They don't have a connection to the people and they don't feel accountable to the people and that's the number one problem.
Trump endorsed David Perdue after Kemp failed to overturn the results of Georgia's 2020 presidential election.
Harrington blamed the baby formula shortage on "weak RINOs" who allowed President Joe Biden to take office.
"These people are so out of touch," Harrington explained.
They'll sell out our country while it goes to hell."
Watch the video below from Real America's Voice.
"We never would have had this," she insisted.
They think they're entitled to power.
